06781c89-42c7-444c-8088-b5c76e2dce82.description: Earners of the "Boring Is Bad" badge have compared prominent beliefs and practices about instruction and human learning. They have examined sample learning experiences that were crafted to achieve different outcomes and analyzed effective approaches to learning experience design. Earners have explored the importance of attention in the learning process and the features an instructional experience must have to engage people with learning.
06781c89-42c7-444c-8088-b5c76e2dce82.name: Design 100: Boring Is Bad

badge_template_activities.title: Attend the 4-hour "Design 100: Fundamentals of Design for e-Learning" course through the Allen Academy.
Complete design exercises and discussion activities in the Design 100 course.

d5272776-be77-425e-8825-62c490d12dcf.description: Earners of the "Building Instructional Interactions" badge have created dynamic instructional interactions in a popular e-learning authoring tool (Articulate Storyline or Adobe Captivate). Earners have constructed multiple instructional activities, incorporating rich graphics, meaningful content, and meaningful learner choices. Text content and media assets were provided, but earners built several interactions independently.
d5272776-be77-425e-8825-62c490d12dcf.name: Design 102: Building Instructional Interactions

badge_template_activities.title: Attend Design 102 sessions and participate in discussion and activities.
Complete “brain teaser” development assignments between sessions.

f946abe8-1110-4f51-bca0-107eeefcbebc.description: Earners of the "Instructional Interactivity" badge have studied the principles behind effective instructional design: how learning experiences can be crafted to allow learners to acquire information and skills faster and more accurately than they would otherwise. Earners have demonstrated the ability to conceive of performance-focused learning experiences using the CCAF framework, considering the performance context, challenges, actions, and feedback needed for meaningful learning.
f946abe8-1110-4f51-bca0-107eeefcbebc.name: Design 101: Instructional Interactivity

badge_template_activities.title: Attend Design 101 sessions and participate in discussion and activities.
Complete design exercises and assignments between sessions.

eafe2d02-5bee-40c0-af47-19a927964b55.description: Earners of the “Short Sims” badge have explored the learning psychology behind Short Sims with guru, Clark Aldrich. Earners viewed and interacted with many examples of Short Sims and case studies. Finally, earners of this badge have successfully designed a Short Sim, gained development experience using modern interactive tools, and shared their Short Sims for testing and feedback.
eafe2d02-5bee-40c0-af47-19a927964b55.name: Training with Short Sims

badge_template_activities.title: Earners actively participated in 7.5 hours total (5 x 90-minute instructor-led sessions).
Earners designed a Short Sim, intended for use by the students and employees they currently support.

b6c6699c-c4f6-4a22-a357-487d52f6d18e.description: Earners have studied the principles behind applied learning: how people acquire information and skills, and how they learn to apply information and skills as behavior. Earners have demonstrated an understanding of key concepts in learning psychology such as attention, motivation, memory encoding and recall. They have analyzed learning experiences from behaviorist, cognitivist, and constructivist perspectives, and explored how e-learning can be designed to align with these perspectives.
b6c6699c-c4f6-4a22-a357-487d52f6d18e.name: Design 103: Designing for e-Learning

badge_template_activities.title: Attend Design 103 sessions and participate in discussion and activities.
Complete analysis exercises and assignments between sessions.

f2765139-486e-48fa-847d-66ec0e907378.description: Earners of the "Allen Certified Instructional Professional - Level 1" certification have demonstrated comprehensive skills in designing and developing interactive learning experiences. They are capable of analyzing organizational needs, identifying learning outcomes needed to achieve desired changes in human performance, designing learning experiences to elicit those learning outcomes, and developing such experiences in Articulate Storyline or Adobe Captivate.
f2765139-486e-48fa-847d-66ec0e907378.name: Allen Certified Instructional Professional - Level 1

badge_template_activities.title: Design 101: Instructional Interactivity
Design 102: Building Instructional Interactions
Design 103: Designing for e-Learning
Design 104: Practicum and Individual Coaching

508896f0-b7e8-4315-ad5b-9713c7e73654.description: Earners of this badge attended the Leading Agile e-Learning Development course from the Allen Academy delivered through HR.com. Earners demonstrated the skills necessary to work successfully using Successive Approximation and conduct Savvy Starts to build effective learning experiences. Earners used iterative design practices to create performance objectives, sketch learner-centered designs, facilitate rapid evaluation sessions, and gained experience with processes to balance scope and budget.
508896f0-b7e8-4315-ad5b-9713c7e73654.name: Successive Approximation Model

badge_template_activities.title: Successive Approximation Model (SAM)

402e379e-7ab9-417f-a91d-d8a14b3993d6.description: Earners of this badge have attended and successfully participated in Allen Academy's Sketching and Prototyping for e-Learning Development workshop. Earners have demonstrated active techniques and strategies used to implement iterative design in their organization.
402e379e-7ab9-417f-a91d-d8a14b3993d6.name: Sketching and Prototyping for e-Learning Development

badge_template_activities.title: Earner has successfully participated in the Sketching and Prototyping for e-Learning Development workshop with Allen Academy.

7bad6ce2-9af1-4f1c-a3d3-c22ecab3ac42.description: Earners of the "Practicum and Individual Coaching" badge have created a digital learning experience that meets or exceeds rubric standards. Earners must have created at least one e-learning interaction that features learner-centered design, technical excellence, instructional design, execution of media, and CCAF structure (Context, Challenge, Activity, Feedback).
7bad6ce2-9af1-4f1c-a3d3-c22ecab3ac42.name: Design 104: Practicum and Individual Coaching

badge_template_activities.title: Attend Design 104 sessions and participate in discussion.
Create a digital learning experience that meets or exceeds rubric standards.
Meet individually with the instructor twice during the practicum period for coaching and project feedback.

8da8c39a-1806-4d08-87a2-a5746e8521fc.description: This hands-on workshop leads participants through the features in Articulate Storyline to create engaging interactions and training materials that are compliant with ADA requirements.
8da8c39a-1806-4d08-87a2-a5746e8521fc.name: Designing 508(c) Compliant e-Learning

badge_template_activities.title: Badge earners have attended the 4-hour workshop and demonstrated skills to transform high media interactions into 508(c) compliant training, discuss design compromises and technical considerations for ADA compliant training, and explore CCAF instructional interaction principles to enhance and support 508(c) learning. Topics will include: keyboard-driven interactions, closed captioning, alt-tags, tab orders, grouping, and more.

82e525f2-5d6d-4f7c-9a53-5560e86f3485.description: Earners of this badge attended the Effective Learning Strategies course from the Allen Academy delivered through HR.com. Earners demonstrated the skills necessary to understand the cognitive science behind educational strategies and implications for organizational learning that create effective learning experiences.
82e525f2-5d6d-4f7c-9a53-5560e86f3485.name: Learning Science

badge_template_activities.title: In order to obtain the Learning Science badge, participants of the Effective Learning Strategies course through Allen Academy and HR.com must satisfactorily attend synchronous meetings and complete interactive course activities designed to improve understanding of cognitive learning.

996ef48d-5274-4658-bd1e-d0914e697450.description: Earners of this badge have attended and successfully completed in-course activities for the lecture portion of First Principles of Instruction with Professor M David Merrill. Earners were taught the skills necessary to understand the interactive theories and application for effective learning practices through instruction utilizing Merrill's Pebble-in-the-Pond model and five Principles of Instruction.
996ef48d-5274-4658-bd1e-d0914e697450.name: First Principles of Instruction - Level 1

badge_template_activities.title: This lecture series teaches the five pillars of Dr. Merrill's Principles of Instruction and how they help build effective learning solutions that promote education through problem-solving.  In this course, you will:  See the principles applied to a variety of content areas Learn how you can design appropriate instructional events and strategies for your own instruction.

e90986eb-39f6-402d-bfee-f5dcc6b0ced0.description: Earners of the "mobile" badge have explored prominent strategies, designs, and implementations of mobile learning applications with Dr. Clark Quinn. They have developed prototypes and designs of mobile applications to supplement formal learning experiences, outlined mobile performance support solutions, and crafted strategies to apply sensor data adding powerful contextualizions for students. Earners also explored non-traditional experiences that leverage social interactions to support learning.
e90986eb-39f6-402d-bfee-f5dcc6b0ced0.name: Mobile Learning Strategy & Design

badge_template_activities.title: Attend 6, 90 minute vILT sessions in the "Mobile Learning Strategy and Design" course through the Allen Academy.
Develop multiple design exercises and discussion activities in the "Mobile Learning Strategy and Design" course through the Allen Academy.

5875dd0a-d453-4ac6-af0f-13354fd9a723.description: This course coaches students to flip curricula development on its head, designing first for outcomes and skills organizations want to improve and second to motivate students through a visual presentation of how individual performances align to what matters most. Participants engage in challenging activities that allow the application of new methods of design and development to existing or upcoming projects.
5875dd0a-d453-4ac6-af0f-13354fd9a723.name: Performance-Focused Learning Paths

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of course includes attending five weeks of weekly, virtual, face-to-face sessions with the instructor; large and small groups, and pair work. Self-paced tool practice, exercises, and reflection each week. Prompted weekly discussion with peers and instructor. Focus on conversations and the holistic context ensures you can overcome the barriers that usually get in your way.

skills.name: Championing A Culture Of Learning And Development

923c9c49-e0eb-4b4e-8846-32b4341c0e74.description: Earners of this badge attended the L&D's Playbook for the Digital Age course from the Allen Academy delivered through HR.com. Earners demonstrated the skills necessary to formulate a short- and long-term learning strategy based on evolving business needs in the digital age.
923c9c49-e0eb-4b4e-8846-32b4341c0e74.name: L&D's Playbook for the Digital Age

badge_template_activities.title: In order to obtain the L&D Playbook badge, participants of the L&D's Playbook for the Digital Age course through Allen Academy and HR.com must satisfactorily attend synchronous meetings, participate in interactive course discussions, and complete the playbook creation and revision activities designed to improve understanding of organizational learning.

9bf15127-ac5b-4d3f-92a2-74080fd968fd.description: Earners of this badge have attended and successfully completed in-course activities for both the studio and lecture portions of First Principles of Instruction with Professor M David Merrill. Earners demonstrated the skills necessary to understand the interactive theories and application for effective learning practices through application utilizing Merrill's Pebble-in-the-Pond model and five Principles of Instruction.
